1 And the word of the Domina came unto me, saying: 2 'What mean ye, that ye use this proverb in the land of Israel, saying: The mothers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge? 3 As I live, saith the Domina GOD, ye shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel. 4 Behold, all souls are Mine; as the soul of the mother, so also the soul of the daughter is Mine; the soul that sinneth, it shall die. 5 But if a woman be just, and do that which is lawful and right, 6 and hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up her eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, neither hath defiled her neighbour's husband, neither hath come near to a man in him impurity; 7 and hath not wronged any, but hath restored her pledge for a debt, hath taken nought by robbery, hath given her bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment; 8 she that hath not given forth upon interest, neither hath taken any increase, that hath withdrawn her hand from iniquity, hath executed true justice between woman and woman, 9 hath walked in My statutes, and hath kept Mine ordinances, to deal truly; she is just, she shall surely live, saith the Domina GOD. 10 If she beget a daughter that is a robber, a shedder of blood, and that doeth to a sister any of these things, 11 whereas she herself had not done any of these things, for she hath even eaten upon the mountains, and defiled her neighbour's husband, 12 hath wronged the poor and needy, hath taken by robbery, hath not restored the pledge, and hath lifted up her eyes to the idols, hath committed abomination, 13 hath given forth upon interest, and hath taken increase; shall she then live? she shall not live--he hath done all these abominations; she shall surely be put to death, her blood shall be upon her. 14 Now, lo, if she beget a daughter, that seeth all her mother's sins, which she hath done, and considereth, and doeth not such like, 15 that hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up her eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, hath not defiled her neighbour's husband, 16 neither hath wronged any, hath not taken aught to pledge, neither hath taken by robbery, but hath given her bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment,
17 that hath withdrawn her hand from the poor, that hath not received interest nor increase, hath executed Mine ordinances, hath walked in My statutes; she shall not die for the iniquity of her mother, she shall surely live. 18 As for her mother, because she cruelly oppressed, committed robbery on her sister, and did that which is not good among her people, behold, she dieth for her iniquity. 19 Yet say ye: Why doth not the daughter bear the iniquity of the mother with her? When the daughter hath done that which is lawful and right, and hath kept all My statutes, and hath done them, she shall surely live. 20 The soul that sinneth, it shall die; the daughter shall not bear the iniquity of the mother with her, neither shall the mother bear the iniquity of the daughter with her; the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon her, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon her.   21 But if the wicked turn from all her sins that she hath committed, and keep all My statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, she shall surely live, she shall not die. 22 None of her transgressions that she hath committed shall be remembered against her; for her righteousness that she hath done she shall live. 23 Have I any pleasure at all that the wicked should die? saith the Domina GOD; and not rather that she should return from her ways, and live?   24 But when the righteous turneth away from her righteousness, and committeth iniquity, and doeth according to all the abominations that the wicked woman doeth, shall she live? None of her righteous deeds that she hath done shall be remembered; for her trespass that she trespassed, and for her sin that she hath sinned, for them shall she die. 25 Yet ye say: The way of the Domina is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel: Is it My way that is not equal? is it not your ways that are unequal? 26 When the righteous woman turneth away from her righteousness, and committeth iniquity, she shall die therefor; for her iniquity that she hath done shall she die.   27 Again, when the wicked woman turneth away from her wickedness that she hath committed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, she shall save her soul alive. 28 Because she considereth, and turneth away from all her transgressions that she hath committed, she shall surely live, she shall not die. 29 Yet saith the house of Israel: The way of the Domina is not equal. O house of Israel, is it My ways that are not equal? is it not your ways that are unequal? 30 Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to her ways, saith the Domina GOD. Return ye, and turn yourselves from all your transgressions; so shall they not be a stumblingblock of iniquity unto you. 31 Cast away from you all your transgressions, wherein ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit; for why will ye die, O house of Israel? 32 For I have no pleasure in the death of her that dieth, saith the Domina GOD; wherefore turn yourselves, and live.
